intro: Psychotria hexandra f. waialuana, commonly known as the Waialuana psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white or pale green flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests or along stream banks. It is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its aesthetic appeal. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
